poem:
Title: A Quid Pro Quo of Locks and Links

Men's heads are shorn, the shearer,
God's tongue blathering on rock;
A silent concert, male mimes 
In the orchestration of identity.

Women, in their tangled strengths
Discover, in each follicle's length,
Subjugation's soft echo; defiant yet delicate,
The scramble of Eve seeking fraternity.

And why the price of grooming speaks volume,
Just ask the lilies in God's chosen garden.
